data.message: I have some things that I am willing for the public to see and other things I want friends and family to see. But don't know how to distinguish the selection for what is family and friends verses public. I don't want to have to make that distinction for everything I post. It would become very tedious for me to have to do that.

replies.message: Hey Mrs. James Clemons. The audience selector tool remembers the audience you shared with the last time you posted something, and uses the same audience when you share again unless you change it. For example, if you choose Public for a post, your next post will also be Public unless you change the audience when you post. Learn more: https://www.facebook.com/help/120939471321735 -Sarah
But when you change the audience of a current post, does it then change the visibility of PREVIOUS posts as well?
Your future selections of audience do not affect your previous selections, Dan. -Sarah
Facebook  why  is  my  page  locked
